conversations.value: Look at that, Chandler. It's like the roses on the shower curtain are trying to escape into the boring real world, don't you think?
It's like the Secret Garden decided to go incognito in a witness protection program for bathroom decor.
Yeah, except the roses aren't being very subtle. If I were a rose trying to blend in, I'd turn into a tile pattern, maybe grow some grout thorns.
Speaking of blending in, that trash can really nailed the 'try not to stand out' vibe.
What do you think, Chandler? Should I get a shower curtain like that? It could be an inspiration for a new song.
Absolutely, your next hit could be "Wet Roses," the splashy ballad the world didn't know it needed.
I can hear it now. "Wet roses, lost in showers, longing for their flowery powers..."
Now, what do you suppose is hiding behind the curtain? Maybe an alternate dimension where everyone appreciates Janice's laugh?
Or maybe a portal to an actual rose garden. I could meet some cool garden gnomes or a flower fairy!
Garden gnomes and flower fairies... is that Phoebe code for 'too much herbal tea before bed' again?
No, silly! It's Phoebe code for 'possibilities are endless'. And hey, what if behind that curtain, we find the secret to bigger boobs? I wouldn't be mad.
You know if that were true, I think Joey would never leave the bathroom. He'd probably camp out there waiting for the boob fairy.
Oh look at these, Chan! They're absolutely adorable! Do you think they'd make good presents for Erica and Jack?
Well, they are cute, but I'm not sure how much street cred they'd have in the playground. "Oh hey, check out my fluffy bunny in a bathrobe!" It’s not exactly GI Joe.
They're bunnies, Chandler, not Navy SEALs. Plus, the pink bathrobes? That is classic. It's like... they're ready for a spa day.
Spas, yes, because our toddlers live such stressful lives. Their nap schedule must be grueling.
You know very well the twins have tough days. Remember that park incident with the seesaw?
I do. It was like 'Nam. Flashbacks to when I thought the duck was going to profess its love for me. Okay, okay, the bunnies can be our backups if the toy store is out of tiny commando outfits.
Backup?! These are not backup gift material, Bing. Look at their tiny little slippers! Also, did you just make a joke about the duck at the park?
That duck had an intense stare, Mon. Plus, back to the bunnies – are they holding coffee cups? If so, I might need to reassess their suitability for my own personal collection.
Coffee cups? Where did you... Wait, that's kind of like their version of a morning coffee ritual, isn't it? Like us with our newspaper and quiet time before the chaos starts.
Exactly, except they're probably drinking carrot juice and the news is all about which field has the best clover.
So what you're saying is, we need to get Erica and Jack each a bunny, and keep a set for ourselves? Because I'm totally on board with that.
You're the boss, chef. But we're going drawer-shopping next because if we're going to adopt any more stuffed animals, we'll need somewhere to keep them.
Deal. As long as the drawers are as cute as these little guys here. And they’re Monica clean approved.
Of course, no bunny gets left behind with dust bunnies. Our children deserve a sanitized plush environment!
Look at that stance, Chandler! The focus, the determination! Reminds me of myself when I'm about to whip you in ping pong.
Could she BE any more intense? But I have to say, if that's you in a ping pong match, I'm kind of afraid what you're like in a tennis match.
Come on, you know that competitive Monica is the best Monica. Besides, I'd love to get out on the court and show you how it's done.
Well, I gotta admit, I'm just happy you're not holding a frying pan. Last time you swung one of those around, I had to dodge it like a... Well, like a very scared Chandler.
Ha! Only because you tried to snatch a taste of my famous pasta sauce. This woman's form though, her swing looks professional!
Yes, and while we're observing, please note the absence of flying kitchen utensils. That's really what sets it all apart for me.
You're hilarious. But seriously, I bet I could have been great at tennis. I mean, look at those wrists. They're all about precision.
You? Great at tennis? Honey, you're great at everything you set your mind to. Except, you know, letting someone else control the remote.
That's because everyone should know by now that I have superior TV schedule management skills.
Ah yes, 'Monica Clean', 'Monica Cook', and 'Monica Tv Guide', the trinity of the Monica lifestyle brand.
Exactly! You catch on quick. Now, imagine if I put that kind of organization into coaching tennis.
I can see it now, "Monica’s School of Tennis: Where Love means nothing to you, and we're not just talking about the score."
Hey, Chandler, check this out, huh? You ever use an umbrella to protect yourself from the sun instead of the rain?
Umm, I don't know, Joey. Have you ever seen me use an umbrella inside to protect me from your shower singing? I'm more of a stay-in-the-shade kinda guy.
Man, that's smart! That way your ice cream won't melt, and you can enjoy it longer. Speaking of which, you think that kid might share some of his ice cream?

Joey, haven't we learned anything over the years? "Joey doesn't share food!" And I highly doubt that random child is gonna be any more willing to part with his ice cream than you are with a slice of pizza.
True, true... But y'know, if I were out there, on a hot day, I bet I could get some ice cream with the Tribbiani charm.
I'm sure you could turn the heat up with the classic "How you doin'?"—even the sun would need to wear shades.
Ha! I like that. But look at all these people. It's like a street party or something! We should go there sometime, eat some street food... Oh, I could go for a hot dog right now.
Oh yeah, Joey and Chandler, kings of the street fair. I can see it now, you're getting us kicked out for trying to eat everything, including the napkins.
Hey, only if they're edible! But seriously, doesn't a day out in the sun with good food just sound amazing?
As long as we get to sit somewhere with cover. I burn faster than a marshmallow at one of Phoebe's "séances."
All right, all right, we'll find some shade. But I'm definitely getting us matching umbrellas. None of that black or gray stuff, I'm thinking... bright orange!
Yes, because nothing says "blending in" like walking around with a gigantic orange umbrella. We'd look like a couple of escaped traffic cones.
Exactly, can't lose each other in the crowd! Safety first, man.
And there's no safety from fashion police, apparently. Just promise me we won't end up on the six o'clock news under "Local eccentric duo found chowing down with orange umbrellas."
No promises, Chandler. But hey, it'd give my acting career some exposure, right? "Joey Tribbiani: Actor, Food Lover, and... Umbrella Model?"
Look at this, Chandler. That reminds me of the time Joey thought the milk he drank came straight from the cow like that, without pasteurization.
Well, in Joey's defense, that same belief might have saved a bunch of people back in the day from some pretty bad milk mustaches.
Can you imagine if I was that relaxed while cooking? Just sitting there, making lasagna underneath a cow?
And I'd be right there with you, providing moral support, saying things like "could that BE any cheesier?"
I hate to admit it, but there's something kind of soothing about this picture. Everything's so simple and... organic.
Yeah, I bet the cow's name is something quaint like Betsy, and she probably produces milk that's, I don't know, Monica clean?
Ha ha, very funny. But seriously, that milk must be so fresh. It's kind of making me want breakfast for dinner now.
How about I be your sous-chef? You handle the eggs, and I'll take care of the cow jokes. "MOO-ve over, scrambled eggs!"
Stick to the jokes, Bing. And hands off my kitchen!
As you wish, Chef Monica. Just don't ask me to milk anything.
Oh my God, Chandler, look at this woman in the image. She so reminds me of me, don't you think? It's like she's got that whole 'Monica clean' vibe going on. I bet her kitchen is spotless.
She's definitely got the 'Monica clean' sparkle. I mean, she's practically glowing. If clean had a face, it would be her... or you, my clean and shiny wife.

I'm serious, Chandler! Look at how she's holding that dish towel. It's like an art form. She's a domestic goddess! I mean, if I had to give up being a chef and just wipe dishes like that for a living...

And yet somehow, I can't see you giving up cooking for towel twirling. Unless, of course, there's a Towel Twirling Olympics I don't know about. Do you think that's a thing? Because I think you'd win gold.
Don't be silly, Chandler. But seriously, that kitchen... I wonder if she organizes her spices alphabetically or by region. That's the real question.
I bet she does both. Alphabetically when she's feeling zesty and by region when she's feeling... 'spicy'.
Hmm, that's a good system! You know what? I think I might re-organize our spice rack this weekend. Thanks for the inspiration, mystery woman!
You're welcome? And I'm going to go ahead and reserve my usual spot on the couch while you do that. It's the best seat for the sport of spice sorting.
Just don't forget, you promised to help me with the heavy lifting! I want to move the pots and pans too. It'll be like a mini kitchen makeover!
Ah yes, the sweet, sweet sound of weekend plans. Could we BE any more domesticated?
Look at that, Chandler! Are those zebras not the most well-dressed animals in the animal kingdom?
Well, you could say they’ve really earned their stripes in the fashion world. They're basically walking barcodes, though.
I feel like if I was reincarnated as an animal, I would totally be a zebra. I mean, black and white is such a classic. It goes with everything!
And knowing your track record with Ross, you'll find a way to have an on-again, off-again relationship even as a zebra.
Ha-ha. Very funny. I wonder what it’s like, you know, just waking up and you’re automatically dressed to the nines every day.
I'd love that. Imagine the time I'd save every morning deciding which sweater-vest screams 'I'm a fun guy' today.

But seriously, do you think in, like, the zebra community, there's this one zebra who's stripes aren't quite up to par and the other zebras are like, "Oh, there goes Kevin, didn't get the memo about the dress code"?
Yeah, and there's probably a zebra version of Vogue magazine criticizing the spring stripe collection being "too horizontal" this season.
You know, we should have brought Phoebe. She would have totally communicated with them to find out.
And then she'd come up with a song about it, "Smelly Cat" style. "Stripy Zebra, it’s not your fault... they made you look like a walking vault."
I’m actually kind of jealous though. Look at them! Out in nature, no shopping, yet the epitome of chic!
Yeah, until you realize they can never change their outfit. That's like me wearing the same pair of sweatpants during our entire first year of college.
Please. Like we could ever forget your sweatpants phase, "King of Comfort."
Hey, comfort was key for late-night snack runs and avoiding studying. Plus, nobody knew whether I was coming from a workout or just extremely lazy. It’s called fashion ambiguity, my dear Rachel.
Oh look at this, Chandler! Isn't it beautiful? The train on the move reminds me of the time we took that trip to Vermont. Remember the scenery just whizzing by?
Could it BE any more reminiscent? Yeah, except this train doesn't have the guy snoring like a bear next to us. Good times, good times.
I'm being serious here! There's something so romantic about train rides. We should do it again. Maybe go across the country this time? Just you and me, a cozy compartment...

And a dining car where Monica clean meets dining car clean? But yes, traveling across the country with you does sound tempting. Although, with our luck, we'd probably end up in a sleeper car designed by Joey.
Ha-ha, very funny. But seriously, look at those yellow flowers by the side! They're so vibrant, they'd make a fantastic centerpiece. I could arrange them in so many ways...
Well, you also make a fantastic centerpiece, you know. Just not in a vase. Because that would be weird... and very uncomfortable, I imagine.
Thank you for that... unique compliment. But really, have you noticed how the blue of the train pops against the green? It's so picturesque!
Yes, it's like it's screaming, "Look at me! I'm a blue train in a green world!" And the way the gold accents just tie it all together, it's like train fashion week out there.

You're impossible. But I love that you know about accent colors. However, you have to admit, there's just something calming about this image. It makes me want to dive into a simpler life, maybe outside the city.

Whoa there, Farmer Monica. Remember the last time you tried to take care of a plant? Our windowsill still mourns the loss. But I get it, there is something serene about this. How about this weekend we find our own little slice of calm, minus the trains and potential for agriculture disasters?
Deal! But only if I get to make our picnic basket. I'm thinking of a theme... perfect sandwiches on the perfect lawn. Not just clean, Monica clean!
As long as I get to bring the sarcasm and you don't try to make me eat quinoa. Let's face it, quinoa in a picnic basket is where I draw the line.
No quinoa, I promise. Just the good old sandwich classics. And maybe I'll bake some cookies. It'll be perfect - I know!
Oh. My. God. Cookies made by you? Could this BE any more of a perfect plan?
Oh my god, Chandler, look at this! This guy's stance... it's almost as if he's trying to flirt with the pitcher. Is that a thing in baseball?
If it is, then I must've missed the memo on 'How to Flirt with Sports Professionals'. My technique usually involves nervous rambling and accidentally insulting their favorite team.
You know, I can totally see you doing that. So, what's up with the guy holding what looks like a giant Q-tip? Is he planning to clean a whale's ear?

Actually, that's the batting coach. He's probably giving tips, but hopefully not the Q-tip kind, because "there's resistance!" And speaking of cleaning, do you think they have someone who picks up all the balls, or is it like a golf thing where they just disappear into a hole somewhere?

Well, if they need someone to pick up the balls, I know a few people who could use a day job. I mean, I'd do it just to get out of the house. Oh, maybe I’d look cute in one of those little baseball uniforms—ooo, with a matching cap!
Cute? Yes. Functional? We're talking about the same Rachel who thought 'home base' was a new makeup brand, right? And let's not forget your batting average with that fake plastic tree.
Okay, okay, laugh it up, Mr. 'Sarcasm is my only defense'. At least I'd bring some style to the field. Maybe even start a trend—Baseball, but make it fashion.
Now, that's a game I would actually watch. 'Next up, a double-header featuring Rachel Green's autumn collection, complete with cleats that double as stilettos.'
Don't joke, that could work! Oh, but look at this, Chandler. The stands are so empty. It’s kind of sad, isn't it?

Well, it's just practice, so the stadium is emptier than Joey's fridge on cleaning day. But cheer up, maybe you can fill the void with cheerleaders or a live mannequin display during the seventh-inning stretch?
That's actually not a bad idea. With the right music, lighting, and maybe a dash of sequins, it could be fabulous.
"And here comes the pitch—and wow, what an unexpected turn of events as the first baseman is blinded by a sequin reflection!" Now, that's my kind of baseball.
Whoa, check this out, Chandler! What is this, like, extreme surfing?
Actually, it's called kite surfing. And before you ask, no, you cannot use my new sheets as the kite.
Kite surfing, huh? So the surfboard flies? Man, that's cooler than when I learned you could eat pizza in the bathtub.
Actually, it's the person who kinda flies... with the surfboard still attached. And eating pizza in the bathtub should not be considered a major discovery, Joe.
If the person flies, does that make him a superhero? Because I've always wanted to be a superhero... The Amazing Joey-man!
More like "The Man Who Would Immediately Sink." But sure, you keep dreaming, buddy.
All right, Chandler, but if I become The Amazing Joey-man, I'm gonna need a sidekick. How does The Sarcastic Chandler sound for a hero name?
Well, I think it's utterly appropriate, given my superpower of deflecting enthusiasm with a single quip.
Hey, I could totally take up kite surfing. I've got the muscles, the looks... Wait, do you think this sport could help with my acting career?
Oh sure, because casting directors are famously looking for "the guy who can pretend to surf while being dragged by a giant kite." It's a very specific type.
Look at this, Chandler. This market street feels so vibrant and colorful. But can you spot what's out of place here?
Well, if by "out of place" you mean the only thing not on sale is an antique jeepy thing covered in more psychedelic art than Phoebe's wardrobe, then yeah, totally.
It's called a jeepney, sweetie. And it's not an antique; it's actually a popular mode of transportation in the Philippines. Look at all the details! Imagine the cleaning nightmare though...
I know, right? If it were "Monica clean," we could eat Joey's meatball sub off of it and Joey would still lick the sauce.
Gross, Chandler! But seriously, the fruits and vegetables look so fresh. I bet I could whip up an amazing stir-fry with those. What do you think?
As long as "whip up" doesn't translate to "set the kitchen on fire," I'm all in for whatever my amazing chef wife prepares. Could I BE any luckier?
Awww. You know you have to actually help me in the kitchen then, right? No more sneaking off to play 'Space Invaders' on breaks.
Deal, as long as I get to be your official taste tester. And hey, we could use a stir-fry strategy: "Seven, seven, SEVEN” different veggies.
Ha! I'm holding you to that. Now let's take a closer look; I want to see if they have any cilantro or something I can pretend is cilantro and confuse everyone with my culinary skills.

Just so we're clear, if we end up with a mystery meal, I'm blaming the overly decorated jeepney for inspiring your adventurous cooking streak. Not just clean, Monica clean – but now, not just dinner, Monica dinner!
You love it. And you're literally the only person who could relate my cooking to a jeepney. Only you, Chandler Bing.
And that's why you married me. Well, that and my boyish charm and dashing good looks.
Keep telling yourself that, honey. Now, come on, let's make a list of all those exotic ingredients we'd need to replicate this market at home. You know it's more than just potatoes and onions!
We're going all out. Next thing you know, we'll be turning the balcony into a bazaar. "Chandler and Monica's Mystical Market", I can see it now.
Oh my god, Chandler, look at this! Haven't you always wanted to just... hit the road without a plan, like these motorcyclists?

Well, considering my motorcycle skills are as developed as Joey's cooking skills, that would be a no. But you, Ms. Runaway Bride, I bet this is right up your alley—minus the 'runaway' part this time, hopefully.
Haha, very funny. It just looks so liberating, you know? The open road, the wind in your hair... which, by the way, wouldn't work for me because, hello, hair nightmare!

Yes. Wind: the natural enemy of the flawless hairstyle. I'm not sure which is scarier though, the hair nightmare or the fact that you actually entertained the idea of being the poster child for helmet hair.
Chandler, you just don't get it. It's not about the hair—it's about the freedom. It’s like the time when I got off the plane—oh wait, it is a little bit about the hair.
Freedom, huh? Well, freedom's one thing, but where do they keep their wardrobe? I mean, could their saddlebags BE any smaller?
Okay, Mr. Practicality. I bet you'd have a suitcase just for your sarcasm quips.
You're absolutely right. My sarcasm deserves the utmost care. It's the only thing keeping me safe from all these... crazy, impulsive suggestions.
Says the man who eloped in Vegas. But okay, let's make a deal. If I ever decide to roam the country on a motorcycle, you’re in charge of packing. Deal?
Deal. But I’m packing extra helmets. One for you, one for your hair, and one for the road’s safety from your hair.
Oh my God, Chandler, look at this set up! Isn't it just the dreamiest bedroom setup you've seen? I mean, look at the coordination of the pillows with the comforter!
It is nice, if you're planning to sleep in a window display. I mean, could that BE any more color coordinated?
Funny, but seriously, I love it. The symmetry is perfect, and it’s not just clean—it’s Monica clean. Imagine how peaceful it would feel waking up here.
Peaceful, sure, but wouldn't it be weird if people were always looking at you while you slept? It's like living in a fishbowl with really nice bedding.
I'd have no problem with that. As long as the fishbowl was squeaky-clean and had a thread count through the roof.
I'll remember to install a 'No Fish' sign when we remodel our bedroom. And speaking of fish, why is there a bench at the foot of the bed? That's like a front-row seat to the 'Sleeping Chandler Show'.
That bench could be for extra seating, or you know… when I lay out your clothes because somebody, who shall not be named, doesn’t plan outfits the night before.
I believe that's what gives my fashion choices the spontaneous magic they clearly have, and wait, I don't plan outfits? I'm not even sure which drawer my socks live in.
And that's why I'm here to save the day! Plus, that bedding color is just so us, don't you think? We should get it.
I have no idea how we slip into shopping for bedding while walking down the street, but sure, honey. Let's 'sleep on it' before we make any decisions.
Ha-ha, just remember, if I’m happy, you’re happy… And I'm thinking 'happily ever after' in that bed set.
In that case, we'll take the display, the bench, and throw in a 'Do Not Disturb' sign for good measure. But don't even think about bringing that stool into our house.
Deal! But just so you know, the stool would have been perfect for the guest bathroom.
Oh my God, look at this! Chandler, do you remember the last time we went skiing? This person's stance reminds me of how you were just flailing around trying to stay upright!
Hey, flailing is an essential part of my patented skiing technique. It's a little-known style called 'The Bing Bumble'. It's all the rage in, uh, nowhere.
It was hilarious! But, hey, you've got to give yourself some credit. You did get better by the end of the day. Not “Monica clean” better, but better.

Why thank you, my keenly competitive wife. And I did it all without planting my face in the snow... after the third time. Look at this person though, she seems to be having a blast. Think we should hit the slopes again soon?
Absolutely! But this time, I'm making a training regimen for you. We’ll have you slaloming like a pro! And, oh, Chandler, no 'Bing Bumble' this time, okay? We don’t want to scare the children.

As long as the training regimen comes with a lot of hot cocoa breaks, I'm in. But hey, on the upside, if I 'Bing Bumble' all the way down the mountain, we might get a discount on the lift tickets out of sheer pity!
Deal! But, seriously, she does look pretty confident in this picture. I bet her form is almost as good as mine.
Could you BE any more confident in your skiing abilities? But okay, challenge accepted. Monica and Chandler, the ultimate ski-off. Loser buys the winner a trophy shaped like a snowflake!
It's on! And when I win, I want my snowflake trophy Monica clean, Chandler.
Noted. And when I win, I want a trophy that's more than seven times shinier than yours. But you know, who’s counting?
Get ready for defeat, Bing. This is going to be more satisfying than organizing my sock drawer by color and fabric type!
The intensity, the drama... this is all very exciting for something that isn't a sandwich-making competition. But who knows, maybe I'll surprise you and ski like the wind!
Breeze, Chandler. At best you'll ski like a breeze. The wind is mine!
Hey, Chandler, check this out. What do you think this guy's thinking right now?
Well, if I had to guess, I'd say he's thinking, "Could this tennis ball BE any further away?"
You think he's worried about the ball? Dude, look at his focus. That's the eye of the tiger… or maybe the eye of the lobster, considering all the red.
Lobsters don't play tennis, Joey. But if we ever start an underwater Friends spin-off, I’ll keep that top of mind.
Underwater Friends? Chandler, that's genius! But back to this—do you think I could've been a tennis player?
Oh yeah! With your coordination? They would have to invent a new scoring system. It would go Love, Fifteen, Joey.
Ha-ha, very funny. I could have been great, you know. I'm agile like a cat—or would that be like a lobster?
Definitely a lobster, with the amount of time you spend buttering yourself up for dates.
Hey! It's important to look good. And speaking of looking good, look at this guy's form. It's flawless, like me on a good hair day.
Yes, because as we all know, tennis is 90% hairdo, 10%… whatever the rest of the stuff is they do with the racquets and the grunting.
Did you say racquets? Oh man, I had this dream once where I was playing racquetball with my sandwich. It was tragic. It kept getting smaller each time I hit it.
Well, your sandwich served you well. See what I did there? Serve? Tennis?
I see what you did, and I gotta say, tennis talk suits you. You could be one of those commentators.
Oh yes, "And there he goes, Joey Tribbiani, swinging at the air, and—oh, it's a miss. But look how his hair stays perfectly in place."
You know it, buddy. Alright, enough about tennis. Let's grab a sandwich. Remember, Joey doesn't share food!
At least that's one rule you'll never double-fault on.
Hey Chandler, check out this picture! This street looks kinda familiar, doesn't it? Like the one we got lost on when we tried to find that all-you-can-eat buffet?

You mean the one where you almost got into a fight with a traffic cone because it was 'looking at you funny'? Yeah, I remember. But don't you think all city streets look a bit similar after a while? Especially when you've got your 'I'm so hungry I could eat the upholstery' face on?
That cone was askin' for it, and you know it. But man, all this talk about that buffet is making me hungry. D'you see any good food joints in this pic?
Let me see. Ah, there's a distinct lack of cartoonishly oversized food signs. How will we ever survive?
I'm serious, Chandler! Even a meatball sub billboard or somethin' would be nice. You remember what I said about food billboards, "Why God, why?!"

Because they can't just magically produce a sandwich out of thin air, Joey. But speaking of which, if a sandwich did appear out of thin air, would it be a ghost sandwich? "Paper! Snow! A... sandwich!"
Ha-ha, very funny. Ghost sandwich... Wait, wait, wait, look at that yellow car! Is that the Taxi of Broken Dreams and Missed Opportunities?
Could that BE any more dramatic? I'd like to think of it as the Taxi of Adventure and Unexpected Turnarounds. You know, more of a glass-half-full kinda taxi.
Speaking of full, I really wanna get something to eat now. What do you say, wanna find the real-life version of this street and hunt down a hotdog or something?
You know what, let's do it. As long as it doesn't involve asking directions from inanimate objects, I'm in. Lead the way, Tribbiani.
That's the spirit! And hey, if we do get lost, we can always ask Mr. Traffic Cone for directions again. Heh.
Right, but first, let's make a rule: if we run into any cones, we treat them with respect. We don't want them joining forces and chasing us down the street again.
Look at this, Chandler! Why is that zebra taking a nap in the middle of the day? Isn’t that just the quirkiest thing you’ve ever seen?
Well, either that or it's the laziest zebra ever. It's like me on a Sunday... or any other day of the week.
No, I sense something more spiritual. Maybe it’s dreaming. Perhaps it's connecting with its zebra ancestors in the Great Stripe-y Beyond.

Or maybe it just had a really big lunch and it's regretting that extra helping of savanna grass. You know that feeling, like after Thanksgiving dinner when you're so full you resemble a beached whale?

Ugh, don't remind me of Thanksgiving, you know that's all sorts of wrong. But I think this is a sign, Chandler. We're supposed to learn from the zebra. Live in the moment, stretch out, and soak up life's sunshine.
You might be onto something. Next staff meeting, I'm going to suggest a group nap time. When they ask why, I'll say, 'The zebra told me to do it.' That'll make me look super professional.
You joke, but you know, animals are very wise. They don't overthink things; they just... are. Like this zebra. Well, except for maybe the dolphins; they're up to something.
Yes, the dolphins with their built-in smirks. I always knew they were plotting world domination. Wait until I tell Joey; he'll want in on their plan.
He'll be like the ambassador for humans. Hey, we should let the zebra be in charge of... I don't know, naptime politics or something.
Could we BE any more governed by animals?
As long as it's not the smelly cats, I think we'll be just fine.
Oh my gosh, look at those cows peeking through the fence. It's like they're spying on us. Do you think they're plotting something, Chandler?
Absolutely. They've got that whole "we're planning an elaborate escape heist" vibe. Plus, they're wearing black and white - classic burglar attire.
And look at that one cow staring right at us. It's like she's the mastermind, and the others are just her minions.
Clearly, she's the brains of the operation. Probably spent too much time watching 'The Great Escape.' And can you blame them? Life on the other side of the fence must be 'udderly' exciting.

"Udderly," really Chandler? That's the best you could come up with? But seriously, I'm more interested in this little setup they've got with the fence and that red thing there. Is that a fire hydrant?
It is! Maybe it's part of their cunning plan. Step one: distract humans with adorable cow faces. Step two: bust open the fire hydrant and make a break for it in the ensuing chaos.
That actually sounds like something Phoebe would come up with. So, Mr. Bing, if you were a cow, what would be your master escape plan?

Well, you know me, I'd probably just sarcastically comment on the inadequacy of the fence until it crumbled from insecurity. And then prance away to freedom. And by 'prance,' I mean a cool, manly jog... with dignity.

You "jogging" away to freedom? Now, that's an image I can't miss. But this actually is kind of a nice photo, in a rustic, "middle of nowhere" sort of way. I could totally see it on the wall of a... quaint little coffee shop, maybe?
Yeah, if that coffee shop was in a town called "Eerie Pastures." But hey, if it goes missing, we'll know who the culprits are. Could WE BE any more framed by bovine burglars?
Chandler, you and your... could we BE... jokes. Never change. But um, I wonder what's beyond that fence. Do you think it's more exciting than this side?
How could it not be? There's probably a world of endless grazing and cow tipping jokes. It's their field of dreams. And if you graze it, they will come.
"Field of Dreams?" Watching a bit of Kevin Costner on your movie nights, are we?
I'm a regular at the 'Costner Classics Cinema Club.' But all in black and white, of course. To match our friends here.
I should've guessed. But thanks, Chandler. In a weird way, looking at strange cow pictures with you is kind of comforting.
Anytime, Rach. And if you need someone to help you interpret a snapshot of, let's say, rebellious poultry or a mischievous goat, I'm your guy.
Oh man, check out that beach, Chandler! You thinkin' what I'm thinkin'?
That somewhere out there, there's a turkey sandwich just enjoying its day without the fear of being eaten by you?
No! Well, yes... But no! I'm thinkin' we should totally hit those waves, just like in Baywatch, huh? Minus the slow-mo running.
Well, unless those waves have suddenly turned into a couch with a built-in fridge, I don't see that happening. Plus, I look less like David Hasselhoff and more like... David Hassled-by-waves.

Come on, Chandler! It could be like that time we tried to build entertainment units and ended up with sticking heads. Just imagine the beach as one giant entertainment unit. But with sand. And water. And no TV.
You do realize that your analogy just fell apart faster than Ross's marriages, right?
All right, all right, but look at the surfboard! Maybe we could catch some waves and impress the ladies. A beautiful girl on each arm, the sea breeze in our hair...
Joey, I'm married to Monica. The only beautiful girl I need is her. And the last time I tried to impress her with sports, I ended up with a Wiffle ball stuck in a place where the sun don't shine.
That's true, but hey, I can still work the charm! How you doin', imaginary beach lady?

And I'll be here, watching you, armed with life's two greatest necessities: sarcasm and sunscreen. Because unlike you, my Italian stallion, I don't have the skin tone to combat the fiery ball of agony in the sky.
Haha, I can see it now, "Chandler Bing: The Man Who Battles the Sun".
As long as I don't have to become "Chandler Lobster-Face Bing," I'm in. So, are we really doing this? Surfing?
Absolutely! And after that, the sandwiches – my treat! Well, you’re buying, but I’ll be emotionally supporting the decision.
Could we BE any more prepared for a beach day? Alright, let's do this before I change my mind or the tide goes out, whichever comes first.
Hey, Chandler, check out this image of the bathroom setup. It's giving me major flashbacks to my first apartment after Carol and I split up.
I know! It's like a treasure trove of self-pity and single-tub enlightenment. Could that bathroom BE any smaller?
I know, right? I remember having to dry myself off in the living room because there was no space in there.
The living room-dry-off shuffle. Classic single guy move. You know, if Joey saw that bathroom, he'd probably try to turn the bidet into a second shower.
Ha! Yeah, except that's not even a bidet, it's a... Hold on, is that the sink right next to the shower like that? That has to be some sort of a health hazard.
Seriously, could you imagine me trying to shave in there? I'd come out looking like I got into a fight with a very angry cat.
And look at the toilet placement; it's a logistical nightmare. I mean, you'd have to perform some sort of acrobatic maneuver just to use it.
Yeah, it's like bathroom Twister. 'Left foot, flush the toilet. Right hand, soap up. And... fall into the bathtub – perfect score!'
Honestly, Chandler, I'm just surprised there isn't a laundry machine under the sink to complete the cramped utility experience.

Give it time, Ross. Give it time. This could be the next big thing in multi-functional room design: 'The Bath-laun-dry Room.' Patent that before someone steals the idea—like they did with 'Jurassic Park.'
Ha, very funny. But seriously, there's something charming about a tiny bathroom like that. It forces you to be... I don't know, more efficient with your time and space.
Charming? Ross, you've got a strange sense of charm. Next thing you'll be telling me is that the mold in the grout lines is actually a 'vintage living art exhibit.'
Well, if you frame it that way, we could call it 'The Evolution of Cleanliness' exhibit. See? I can do charmingly humorous, too.
Okay, Ross. But if you start hosting bathroom tours, count me out. Unless you're serving mini sandwiches. And remember—no sharing!
Look at this, Chandler! Can you believe the amount of snow here? This would take forever to clean up.
And let's not forget about the possibility of snowmen with commitment issues; they're here one day and gone the next.
Ha-ha, very funny. But seriously, doesn't this make you think of Christmas? We could have the best holiday party ever in a place like this! Just think about the decorations and the themed snacks!
As long as it doesn’t involve us hosting an outdoor dinner, I’m completely on board. Because the only thing worse than Thanksgiving with my family would be frostbite with my friends.
Don't worry, I have no intention of freezing our guests. I was thinking more about homemade hot chocolate, mulled wine, and your favorite—gingerbread Monica's!
Mmm, now you're speaking my language. As long as I can have a gingerbread Monica without running into a gingerbread Janice.
Deal. Now, what about that guy skiing down the street? It's quite creative when you think about it. Using the snow to your advantage, much like I use parsley.
Absolutely. Because when I see extreme weather conditions, my first thought is how you embellish dishes with herbs.
You know what I mean, Bing. It's about making the best out of a situation. Remember when our Thanksgiving turkey got burnt, and I created that new sauce? Turned into a hit!
Well, your ability to turn disasters into dinner is why we're married. That and your obsessive need to win at table football.
Speaking of winning, imagine how great it would be to have a snowball fight right now! I just know we'd be the ultimate snowball fight champions.
Only if we're not playing against any Actual Yetis. I feel like they would have a natural advantage.
Please! Yetis don't stand a chance against the Bing team. Just promise me you won't make anyone sit in a snow fort after you lose a bet this time.
Can I interest you in a sarcastic comment instead?
It's like you don't even know me! Let's just enjoy the snowy scene before us. We can plan our hypothetical snowball victory later.
Look at these zebras! They're like nature's own barcodes. Do you think each one has a unique pattern that's like, their soul number or something?
Well, if that's true, I hope no one ever scans them at a grocery store. Can you imagine? "That'll be five bucks for the apples, ten for the oranges, and one priceless zebra."
Ha, Chandler, you're so weird. But you know, in a good way. Anyway, don't you think animals should be free to roam, not stuck with price tags?
Absolutely! Free to roam and free from the horror of hearing, "Unexpected item in the bagging area."
Wow. Imagine if they shopped for humans too. "Oh, I'm sorry, this human doesn't fit in your bag."
Yeah, and I'd be the one always causing the machine to freak out. "Please wait for assistance. Your human has been identified as 'Sarcastically Impaired.'"
Aww, poor Chandler. I'd buy you, though. But only if you were on sale.
And I would happily come with a discount coupon. But back to these zebras, do you think one's telling the other a really boring story? You know, because zebras can't yawn graciously.
No, you dork. They're probably sharing ancient zebra wisdom, like where the juiciest grass is, or how to avoid lion attacks.
That's the kind of wisdom I could use. Avoiding my boss is kind of like avoiding lion attacks.
Hey, I have an idea! We should teach them 'Smelly Cat.' It'd be a hit. 'Smelly Zebra,' it has a ring to it, right?
Only if they promise to form a band and go on tour. Ladies and Gentlemen, The Stripey Strummers!
Yes! And their first hit single, “Stripe My Heart.” I can already picture their album cover. Just like this photo!
Well, in that case, I’ll manage their online presence. Could I BE any more digitally inclined?
Oh my gosh, Chandler, look at this! Can you believe these clocks are showing different times? What kind of train station is this?
Well, welcome to the train station of existential crises, where time is a construct and punctuality is a mere suggestion!
It's like, what if each clock represents a different aspect of our lives? Like, one for work, one for personal life, and one for, I don't know... love life?
And judging by these clocks, my love life is still lagging behind. Could this board BE any more representative of my early dating years?

Don't be so hard on yourself. You're married to Monica now, and your love life is literally on schedule. Speaking of, are these clocks broken or is it some sort of public art piece that's beyond my fashion-focused brain?
Knowing my luck, if I were to catch a train here, I'd definitely end up on the one that's running on the clock that's an hour behind. Hello, scenic route to Nowhereville!

Could you imagine if I had to catch a train based on these times? I'd end up either incredibly early or embarrassingly late to a meeting. Either way, someone's getting a very apologetic muffin basket out of me.
A muffin basket from you? Well, time to intentionally mess up the clocks at your office then!
Don't you dare! You know what's worse? Imagine Ross trying to interpret this for an episode of "Fun Bobby's World of Science."
I can see it now, "And if you'll direct your attention here, you will observe the fascinating anomaly where the concept of 'a quarter past' is open to interpretation by each individual line."
Seriously, this picture is stressing me out. It's like I have to figure out which clock to live by, and knowing me, I'd choose the one that gives me the extra time to grab a coffee.

Well, that's the Rachel Green I know, always looking at the bright side of time! So, which one of these would align with our lunch plans? Because I'm getting hungry, and I don't want to rely on "Platform 9¾" over there.
Let's just pick the one in the middle and call it a day. And hey, if we're late, we'll just say we're running on 'Chandler Time.' It's a thing now!
Thank you! Finally, my own time zone. It's a place where sarcasm is the official language and naps are considered a sport.
Look at this, Chandler. That's such a typical cat move, hiding behind the plant.
And to think, evolution led to this moment where a domesticated feline hides from its greatest predator, a ceramic pot. Dun dun dun!
Actually, it's quite interesting behavior from an evolutionary standpoint. Cats retain their instincts to...
Whoa, I did not press my "Ross's science talk" button. Please, let's keep it on mute.
Fine, but there's something both sly and adorable about that cat. It's like it thinks it's a miniature jungle tiger or something.
Yeah, or maybe like it's guarding that green pot. Could that BE any more of a sentinel position? Do you think it's hiding treasure?
If by treasure, you mean the occasional dead mouse... then by all means, yes.
I'm just waiting for it to pop out and say "my pot, MY POT!" like someone I know and his sandwiches.
Ha-ha. Let's not forget who stole my sandwich that one time. The Moist Maker.
In my defense, it was an act driven by hunger and curiosity. How moist was it really? The world may never know.
Well, back to our little feline friend here. I can imagine it's probably seeking a warm, sunny spot while also enjoying a bit of personal space.
You know, that's exactly what I look for in a vacation. Warmth, sunlight, and no people. Cat's really living the dream, isn't it?
Indeed it is, Chandler. Indeed it is.
Oh my gosh, Chandler, look at this! Don't you think there's something so romantic about this street? I can totally see myself walking down there, maybe after a shopping spree, looking fabulous.
Yes, and I can totally see myself being the one carrying all your shopping bags while trying to dodge traffic. Super romantic.
No, but really, doesn't it give you those old movie vibes? Like, I could be wearing a vintage dress, maybe a cute little hat...

Of course. The kind of hat that says, "I may have stolen this from a fashionable granny." And speaking of old movies, where's the part where a charming guy like me sweeps you off your feet just as it starts to rain?
See, now you're getting it! I can almost hear the jazz music playing from a cozy café around the corner.
And I'm here trying to find the street sign that says 'Beware of Puddles'. Because you know I'm all about staying dry and maintaining my boyish charm.
Chandler, your "boyish charm" could probably survive a hurricane. But imagine, we could duck into that café, share a latte... it would be like something out of a storybook.

Only if by "share a latte," you mean you sip the foam off the top and leave me with the actual coffee. And if by "storybook," you mean one where someone's fingers inevitably get turned into latte popsicles.
Come on, you'd love it. It'd be cozy, intimate – maybe they have an open mic, and you could tell some jokes! You're funny, people would love you.
Ah yes, the famous café stand-up routine. Always a hit with the espresso aficionados and the pastel-scarf-wearing poets.
Well, I think you'd be a hit. And I'd be front row, cheering you on.

Well, in that case, how could I refuse? Alright, Rachel Green, you've convinced me. A romantic walk, dodging the rain, carrying your infinite shopping bags, and performing impromptu comedy. What more could a guy ask for?
Oh my God, Chandler, look at this image! Remember the time we tried to throw a surprise party for Phoebe and it ended up being a disaster?
Could this picture BE any more reminiscent of that? I still have nightmares about that vegan, gluten-free cake that tasted like sandpaper.
Haha, yes! But you have to admit, the party hats were a nice touch. This image makes me think we should throw another one, though. Maybe for Monica's next birthday?
A party where everything goes wrong is pretty much the theme of every surprise we attempt. Remember the time Joey tried to jump out of a box and got stuck?

Yes, who could forget? 'Till this day, if I see a box large enough, I think there's a Joey in it. But this crowd here looks like they're having a great time without the hiccups. We could learn something from it.
True. And look, they even have a table crammed with food, just like us. Although, I don't see any 'Mockolate'—which is a definite party foul, if you ask me.
Oh gosh, Mockolate. Let's never speak of that again. But honestly, I love that laid-back vibe. No giant wooden poking devices or turkeys on people's heads.
Well, that's because this isn't a party at our place. There's a distinct lack of 'dysfunction' and 'mayhem.' It's unsettling.
We do have our own special brand of party chaos, don't we? But it's always a blast. Maybe this time we could scale back on the drama... and absolutely no English trifle with beef.
Agreed. Let's keep it simple. No farm animals, and no desserts with layers that could also serve as a main course. Oh, and I vote for no hiring of fake party guests to impress each other.
Deal! Let's make it the best chilled-out, unintentionally disaster-free party yet!
Oh look, Chandler, it's a bus. Do you think it's on its way to Mercedes-Benz World? Because that's what it says, and honestly, I've never known a bus to have such ambitious life goals.
Well, if that bus starts racing around a track, I’d say its life goals are revving up quite nicely. But Mercedes-Benz World? I didn't know cars had their own version of Disneyland.
It must be like a theme park for cars. Do you think they have roller coasters for them to ride on, or just a lot of really big roads?
They probably have thrill rides like 'The Fast and The Luxurious: Avoid the Speed Bump.' But knowing my luck, I'd get stuck in the gift shop.

Wait, do buses even get to have fun, or do they have to work there parking the fancy cars? Because if that's the case, it's one of those sad ironies, like when a dog walker sees someone else walking a dog.
Depressing work scenarios aside, could we take a moment to appreciate the fact that a bus is advertising a world of high-end luxury? That's like me wearing a shirt that says 'GQ Man of the Year.'
Or me wearing a shirt that says "Ordinary Cat" instead of "Smelly Cat." It's just not truthful advertising, you know?
Absolutely. By the way, do you think there’s a world where our picture could end up on the back of a bus? 'Cause I think we’d give these Mercedes a run for their money.
Definitely. Although, I think "Witty and Whimsical: The Chandler and Phoebe World Tour" doesn't quite have the same commercial appeal. But we'd have the most fun!
And our tour buses could have, I don't know, a coffee shop and an arm-wrestling table?
For sure! And instead of these numbers, we could have fortune-telling symbols, and the route would change based on the cosmic energy of the day.
With our combined luck, we'd end up circling the same block all day trying to interpret the universe's 'signals.' Could we BE any more lost?
Hey Chandler, check out this image, doesn't it remind you of that song 'Three Little Birds' by Bob Marley? Except, you know, there are four.
Well, if there was a band named Bob Marley and The Mathematically Challenged, they'd probably have a hit single with 'Four Little Birds'.
Yeah, but seriously, look at them. The way they're sitting on the electricity wires, almost like notes on a musical staff. It's sort of poetic, wouldn't you say?
Are you suggesting we start a band called Ross and the Avian Quartet? Because I have to tell you, my musical talents end at playing the air guitar.

No-no-no, of course not. It's just... there's a quote here, "The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing." It's by Eric Berne. Makes me think about my love for paleontology, sometimes I get so caught up in the details, I forget to just appreciate the beauty of the dinosaurs themselves.
And here I was, thinking the only thing you appreciated about dinosaurs was your ability to bore potential dates at a speed previously unknown to mankind.
Ha-ha. But think about it, Chandler. Don't you ever feel like you're so focused on the sarcasm that you miss out on, you know, genuine moments?
I see your point. It's like that time I was too focused on making jokes in the elevator and completely missed out on getting a date with Jill Goodacre. Could I BE any more oblivious?
Exactly. It's about living in the moment instead of always trying to label it or make a joke out of it.
Speaking of living in the moment, how about we grab a coffee and continue this deep philosophical chat like two birds perched on a wire of life?
That was surprisingly metaphorical of you, Chan... Sure, let's do that. Maybe we can even talk about the possibility of that band...-air instruments included.
Only if I get to be the lead air vocalist.
Oh gosh, look at this, Chandler! What do you think he's celebrating? It looks like one of our typical parties back in the day!
Well, if his hair is any indication, he's clearly celebrating 'World Static Electricity Day'. And trust me, those glasses are the mark of a man who knows fashion – said no one ever.
Oh come on, be nice! I think it takes confidence to pull off those glasses. And I would know, I work in fashion, remember? Plus, I think they're kind of... fun.
Confidence, right. Or lack of mirror. Although, you may have rocked those glasses back when you used to serve coffee and—"Oh, was I not supposed to put beef in the trifle?"
Hey! That was one time. And you ate it without any complaints, thank you very much.
Actually, I think my exact words were, "It tastes like feet." But who am I kidding? If it's free food, you could tell me there's a live chicken in there and I'd still eat it.
There you are with that classic Chandler Bing charm. But seriously, what's with the hair? It's like a 'before' picture in one of those extreme makeover shows.
Well, judging by the blur and that dashing red beverage, I'd say someone's in the middle of an "I don't care how I look" phase. Which, coincidentally, was my entire college career.
True. You had that weird thing where you used to wear two different kinds of socks.
Hey, it was a fashion statement. And no one noticed until you pointed it out! So, thank you for that.
Always happy to help a friend in need of a fashion intervention. But speaking of help, do you think this guy's friends let him go out like that, or is this a bold solo endeavor?
He definitely has friends. They're the ones behind the camera, probably laughing too hard to hold it steady. I would totally do that to Joey.
And I would totally capture the moment for all eternity. It's like this picture is begging to be framed on Joey's wall.
Just as soon as we explain to Joey what "eternity" means.
Hey, Chandler, check this out. Wouldn't it be awesome to just hop on that plane and fly to, I dunno, Italy? I could eat authentic pizza every day!
As appealing as an Italian pizza diet sounds, do you know how many flights we'd have to miss before you realize we're actually in the wrong country?
What do you mean?
Well, remember that time you flew to "Houston, Texas but actually in Canada"?
Yeah. Who knew there was a Houston up there, eh? But look at those colors on the plane, man! It's like it's ready to go to a party and we’re all invited.
Sure, the plane is going to a party and we're the ones bringing those tiny, uncomfortable chairs as a plus one.
Aw, come on. It'll be fun! Plus, you could use a break from work, right? That data trans-configuration-whatever thing.
It's statistical analysis and data reconfiguration, Joe. And you know, escaping from my job to get lost on a runway in what could be the world's slowest vehicle chase, doesn't sound half bad.
Yeah! And I bet I could get us an upgrade to first class. I've got that whole 'actor charm' thing going on. Plus, my soap opera airs in Italy, remember?
Joey, your soap opera character was killed off by a falling elevator shaft. I'm not sure they're rolling out the red carpets just yet.
That's the beauty of soap operas, Chan. Dr. Drake Ramoray has like, nine lives. Also, I can always pull out the "How you doin'?" to the flight attendants!
Right. Because nothing says 'class' quite like hitting on employees tens of thousands of feet in the air.
What's not to like? Plane? Good. Italy? Good. Food? Good!
I give up. You're right. Let’s just hope the pilot doesn't decide it's a 'moo point' and takes us somewhere entirely different.
Hey, as long as they got sandwiches, I'm good wherever we land!
Look at this, Chandler! Isn't this the cutest little food truck you've ever seen? It reminds me of the tiny emergency wedding dress I kept at Bloomingdale's... just in case.
Could that BE any smaller? If that's an emergency food truck, I wonder if they specialize in miniature bagels. You know, for when you're not quite hungry enough for real-sized food.
Are you kidding? Miniature bagels could be a New York sensation! We could start a business! Oh, but it might be hard with my job at Ralph Lauren and Emma...

And if the bagels don't work out, we could just pivot to distributing teeny tiny samples of perfume. Although given how clumsy I am, by the end of the day, I'd probably end up smelling like an over-enthusiastic department store clerk.
Seriously, though! We could totally do it. I mean, I have fashion line experience, and you... well, you're really good at... making people laugh!

Well, every business needs its jester, right? I can see it now: "Chandler Bing: King of Tiny Comestibles and Jokes". Though, I think Joey might eat all the profits. He already considers ‘bite-sized’ a challenge rather than a serving size.
Chandler, focus! Imagine the possibilities – we’re talking about making food both adorable and economical. We could start a trend here, maybe even a franchise!
True, I do like the idea of cutting costs. It's like, "Hey, want to run a food truck without the truck or the food waste? Get the Happy Mini-Mobile!"
We could even serve mini-mocktails named after all of us. Tell me you couldn't see yourself sipping on a 'Sarcastic Chandler'?
Is that the one that leaves you with a lingering sense of dry humor and a hint of commitment issues? Because I think they already serve that at my family Thanksgivings.
Oh wow, look at that, Chandler! It's like a big metal bird that wants to take all the little people to a warmer nest.
Could it BE any more of an airplane? Also, why do you make it sound like migration season for tiny businessmen?
No, it's just that don't you ever think about how humans are like little ants, carrying their little crumbs onto that giant mechanical beast?
And yet, ironically, it's the crumbs in my seat that will be my undoing on a cross-country flight.
I wish I could be there, you know, to see if the spirits are at ease at 30,000 feet. Do you think they serve ghost drinks?
If they do, I hope they come with those little ghostly pretzels. But, Phoebe, how do you suppose a ghost would fasten its seatbelt?
Silly, ghosts don’t need seatbelts. They’re free to roam about the cabin. And go through the cabin, and out of the cabin...
Speaking of going through things, have you ever noticed how going through airport security is like being auditioned for a very low-budget sci-fi movie?
I know, right? They wave that wand over you, and I half-expect to be teleported to another dimension. One where Smelly Cat is a top-ten hit.
And in that dimension, air travel is probably just people flapping their arms really hard, saving tons on fuel!
Ha! If only! You know, maybe in another life I was a penguin. I could see myself just waddling onto that plane, going back home to Antarctica.
As endearing as that image is, I don't think penguins appreciate in-flight movies. "Happy Feet" might hit too close to home.
True, but at least they wouldn't have to worry about lost luggage. All they own is... well, feathers.
Well, wherever those little ant-people are going, I hope they remember to enjoy the peanuts—both literally and the ones sitting next to them.
Hey Chandler, check out this picture. It's a church with a 'WRONG WAY' sign pointing right at it. What do you make of this, huh?
Well, I guess if you're driving towards enlightenment, you're going the wrong way.
Oh man, do you think it's like, a sign from above saying we got it all backwards?
Or maybe it's just telling us not to drive into the church. Which is good advice, generally.
True, true. But hey, you think someone did that on purpose? Y'know, for laughs?
With our luck, we'd probably find out it's a deeply religious street sign holder with a great sense of irony.
It's pretty wild though, right? A church... and then 'WRONG WAY.' It's like me walking into a diet convention.
Or me walking into my high school reunion and everyone’s expecting me to be that guy who made it big in something other than sarcasm.
Speaking of big, this sorta reminds me of when I got that big break with Dr. Drake Ramoray, and then I did that dumb interview...
Yup, taking a 'WRONG WAY' down memory lane there, Joe. But hey, at least you weren't killed off by falling down an elevator shaft.
Yeah! Wait... Too soon, man. Too soon. Anyway, what would be the 'WRONG WAY' sign in your life, Chandler?
Hmm, probably every time I decided to call Janice... Oh. My. God.
Haha, talk about going in the wrong direction, buddy!
Please, my wrong directions should have their own frequent flyer program.
You know, this could be like one of those deep, thoughtful things, right?
Profound, Joe. Tell you what, next time we see a sign like this, let's just hope it's in front of an all-you-can-eat buffet for you or like, a quality sarcasm workshop for me.
That'd be the 'RIGHT WAY' for sure!
Oh look at this, Chandler! Can you believe it's like none of these people have ever seen a camera before?
Well, if I were eating a salad that green, I'd want the world to know I was being healthy too.
Seriously, the girl in the front is just giving the 'I'd rather be shopping' look, which, by the way, I totally get.
And there's guy smiling at the camera like he's just been told there's a second dessert. I mean, could he look any happier?
Notice how everyone's focused on something different? It's like, guys, the point of a group photo is to at least pretend you're having fun together.
Pretend? You mean like we do at our Thanksgiving dinners?
Chandler, look at her plate, though. It's like a work of art with how it's all arranged. You ever think about doing that with your food instead of just shoveling it in?
Hey, I'll have you know I consider my eating style to be less 'shoveling' and more... 'efficient dining.'
And that dress with a lanyard combo—very cutting edge. Maybe it’ll be the next big thing in the fashion world.
Yes, because nothing says high fashion like a plastic ID badge swinging from your neck. It's the accessory I never knew I needed.
Well, at least they're all looking healthy. Y'know, with their salads and... actually caring about what they eat.
Are you suggesting we start a salad club? Because I feel like that's a slippery slope ending in a world where cheesecake is just a myth.
Oh wow, check this out, Chandler. The organization here is almost as meticulous as Monica’s kitchen, wouldn’t you say?
Absolutely. If those spice racks were any more aligned, I swear they’d be a part of the military.
You know, this is actually a great space-saving solution. I always end up knocking over my spices when I'm cooking. It's like they’re playing dominoes in there.
It’s a bit like your love life then, things just keep falling over one after the other.
Ha-ha, very funny. But seriously, I'm thinking of getting one of these for my place.
And you think this will prevent that infamous "We were on a break" casserole from tipping over?
I thought we agreed never to speak of the casserole incident, Chandler. But yes, I do think a little kitchen organization could potentially save my culinary endeavors.
Well then, let’s just hope your casserole has better luck than your marriages.
Okay, okay, enough of that. I'm turning over a new leaf here. Clearly, I need to spice up my kitchen management. Literally.
Well, Ross, as long as you’re not planning to cook for any more dates, I think the women of New York will thank you. And these little jar things, they could be your culinary salvation.
Look at this! Do you think that snowboarder is flirting with gravity? Because, trust me, gravity is about to swipe left.
Well, if he's trying to impress gravity, he might have picked the only force in the universe that's literally incapable of being pushed away.
Huh. Wouldn't it be cool if we could all just defy gravity whenever we wanted to? I would totally go to Saturn and serenade the rings.
And I would go to a place where the concept of Thanksgiving doesn't exist. Could I BE any more thankful for that?
You and your Thanksgiving issues... Hey, do you think that guy's wearing a cape, or is that just a really funky scarf situation?
Definitely a cape. Because nothing says "superhero" quite like plummeting uncontrollably down a mountain.
I know, right? If I were a superhero, I'd be like, "Phoebe, the Pummeler of Evil... and Singer of Truths!" Mostly because Regina Phalange was already taken.
How about "Chandler, the Sarcastic Sling-Shooter"? Pew pew! My weapon would be a sarcastic quip that confuses villains into submission.
That's actually pretty good. Although, I think the guy in orange is the real hero here. He's just chilling, taking photos. Totally unbothered by the flying human nearby.
I'm convinced that's his superpower—extreme chill. Either that or he has no idea because he's too busy trying to get a good selfie for Snowboarders Who Stand Around Digest.
Hey, Chandler, check out this guy. Looks like he had a rough day, huh?
Definitely. Either that or he just realized he's wearing a tie that matches our kitchen wallpaper.
Haha, yeah. And look at his face. He's all, "Why God, why? We had a deal. Let the others grow old, not me!"
Or, "Could he BE any more asleep?"
You think he's dreaming about something nice? Like... pizza or playing foosball?
With that frown? My guess is he's having a nightmare about being trapped in a department store without a single recliner in sight.
Oh man, that's awful. No one should be denied the right to a good recliner nap, especially me.

Yes, and there should be a constitutional amendment for your right to "Nap in Recliners". But back to our sleepy friend—I bet he's a businessman, maybe he just closed a deal on selling those... what's that word you can't pronounce? Oh, yeah, 'satchels'.
It's not that hard, Chan-d-ler. You know, he kinda reminds me of my character, Dr. Drake Ramoray, after a long surgery. Only, this guy doesn't have a sexy nurse waiting for him.
And I'm pretty sure Dr. Ramoray never conducted surgery in a subway. Though, that would be one heck of a plot twist.
I'll pitch that to the writers! Dr. Ramoray, the subway surgeon. Hey, this could be my ticket back to "Days of Our Lives!"
Yes, because nothing screams medical drama like the E train during rush hour.
Chandler, look at this pizza! Have you ever seen a pizza this symmetrically imperfect? The cheese distribution is, like, completely off-balance!
Well, you know, imperfections are the things we love the most about the ones we... Yeah, no, that's just a badly made pizza.
I mean, I can't even imagine how this happened. How does someone not realize they're creating a culinary catastrophe here? It's Pizza 101!

I’m willing to bet a Joey’s special – two pizzas – that the person responsible for this pizza was either A: in a rush, B: new, or C: me, because let's face it, I’m not great in the kitchen unless eating is involved.
If it were you, I'd make you attend one of my cooking classes as punishment. No one should let a pizza suffer like that. I should send them a detailed plan on cheese dispersal.
A plan? And how exactly would said plan be enforced? By the pizza police? "Freeze! Step away from the mozzarella and put your hands where I can see them!"
Laugh all you want, Bing. This is a serious culinary crime! Someone should teach them the right way. And yes, if there was a pizza police, I'd be chief commissioner.

Chief Commissioner Geller, cleaning up the streets one slice at a time. You know, if you wanted to, you could probably fix that pizza with just one look. Or you know, your extreme clean aura could just scare the cheese into redistribution.
Seriously, Chandler! I can't even focus on anything else. The cheese is uneven, the crust looks undercooked. It's just... it's so wrong!
Relax, Mon. In the grand scheme of things, it's just a pizza. We can order another one - hopefully from a place where the pizza maker doesn't think cheese is a suggestion.

You're right, you're right. It's just hard to overlook these things. It's like the time Ross wore that shirt with the tiny stain I couldn't stop staring at. I'll be okay... just... don't show me any pictures of salads made without color coordination, okay?
No promises, but I'll do what I can. Let's just not invite that pizza over for game night. I don't think it could handle your Pictionary skills.
Check this out, Chandler. Doesn't this pitcher's form remind you of that time I tried to teach Ben to play baseball?
Absolutely. But the difference is this guy actually knows what he's doing. I mean, do you remember the way you threw the ball? It was like watching a giraffe on ice skates.
Hey! I'll have you know, back in high school, I was known for my knuckleball.
Uh-huh, and I was known for my duck face long before it was cool on social media. We all have our talents.
You know, if I hadn't gone the paleontology route, who knows? I could've been a pro pitcher.
Could you BE any more delusional? You're the guy who once threw his back out just by picking up a remote.
Well, I had pulled an all-nighter at the museum the day before, my muscles were tense.
And I'm sure the remote was made of solid lead, right?
Laugh all you want, but athleticism runs in the Geller family. Monica ran circles around you guys at Thanksgiving football.
True, but let’s not forget who married that circle-running Geller. Hint: it’s not the guy making a living throwing fastballs.
Imagine, though, the cheering crowds, the smell of the stadium, um, the... um, tight pants?
Tight pants? Ross, if you were seeking tight pants, you could've just borrowed some of Joey's jeans. He still believes one day they'll come back into fashion.
Maybe it's not too late, I could join a local team, get some practice in.
Ross, with your track record? I can already see the headline: "Local Paleontologist on the Disabled List: Dinosaur Bones Safer Than Baseball."
Ha-ha, very funny. Next time Ben asks for baseball tips, you're up.
Great! Don't be surprised when he starts using a fossilized dinosaur egg as a ball. It'll be our little nod to the paleontology-sports crossover series.
Chandler, look at this sandwich. I mean, where's the love? Where's the culinary dedication? I wouldn't even serve that at a doll's tea party.
I know! And the salad’s so small, it makes that tomato slice look like it won a size contest.
And let's talk about presentation. It's just sad. It's like someone said, 'Hey, you know what this plate needs? A lonely cucumber slice to represent all the joy that's missing from this meal.'
If joy is missing, I guess we can't ask it to come back on such short notice. Should we file a missing flavor report?

Very funny, Mr. Bing. But seriously, if I ran the kitchen that made this, I'd institute a three-step program: Step one, apologize to the bread. Step two, introduce vegetables that aren't auditioning for 'The Most Depressing Salad Ever'. And step three, actually season the filling!
Mmm, I see a Monica's Sandwich Emporium in our future. With the slogan: "Not just full, Monica full!"
Don't start with me. I'd make it happen and you'd be my best customer, you know it. Imagine the sandwiches I could create. Layers of flavor, the freshest ingredients...
I'm picturing it. Along with the ten-page manual on how to properly layer a sandwich. All employees must pass a strenuous 'Monica-Approved' technique seminar, right?
Laugh it up, but you and I both know I'd rock that sandwich shop. And there’s a little something valuable in a 'Monica-Approved' certificate. It could be a whole thing!
Sweetie, with your cooking, I have no doubt. You could sell ice to a polar bear if it had your culinary magic touch.
Exactly, because I wouldn't just give him plain ice. It'd be artisanal ice cubes infused with the essence of fresh salmon.
You’d revolutionize the polar dietary plan! And on the plus side, the polar bears would have great breath for their dates.
You're ridiculous. Ok, I'm going to remake this sandwich the right way, and then we can forget this whole tragic experience ever happened.
As long as I'm taste-testing, I'm all in. The things I do for love and good food...
Whoa, check this out, Chandler! What's going on here? You think this guy's okay?
Huh. Well, if he's trying to become one with the bench, I'd say he's doing a pretty good job.
Seriously though, you ever get so tired you just faceplant wherever you are?
Absolutely, like that time we tried to put together all of IKEA's offerings in one day. Remember? By the end, I was ready to curl up on the LACK coffee table.
Oh yeah, but this dude's got his backpack on too! You think maybe he's got a sandwich in there? 'Cause I wouldn't mind a snack.
I doubt it. If it were you, there’d be a Joey-shaped hole in that backpack from where the sandwich was devoured at lightning speed.
Haha, very true. Man, look at him though—sleeping in public. That takes guts!
Or desperation. Reminds me of Ross that one time at the library. He said he was "researching", but we all knew it was a nap.
Yeah, that's Ross for you, but this is like an extreme sport: urban napping!
Urban napping? Is that the next big thing? Forget spin class, I'm going to start teaching competitive lying down.
Hey, you laugh, but if that was a thing, I'd be the king! 'King of Nappers': Joey Tribbiani. Has a nice ring to it, doesn't it?
Can't deny it, you'd be the monarch of mattress-land. Just imagine the royal decree: Thou shalt not shareth food... or nap spots.
You know me too well, man. Oh, and it's always good to have a royal food taster – are you in?
Being your royal food taster? Sounds like a dream job, as long as every meal isn't a sandwich with custard, jam, and meat.
Look Chandler, it's Mother Nature hugging a fire hydrant.
Well, if that's her version of a hug, remind me to never get on her bad side. You know, cause of the poison ivy and... such.
No, no, silly. It's like she's saying, 'Even though you're this cold, metal thingamajig, I shall bring you warmth with my leafy embrace.'
Yeah, or she's playing a very subtle game of capture the flag. Spoiler alert: nature is winning.
You know what this is? It's a symbol of resilience. It's like when I sang 'Smelly Cat' for the first time, and people were laughing, but look at me now! Fire hydrants and I have so much in common.
Aaand now I'm picturing a fire hydrant playing the guitar and singing 'Smelly Cat'. Thanks for that Phoebe, it's not like I wanted to sleep tonight or anything.
Chandler, always using your sarcastic armor. It's okay to feel the hydrant-phoebe connection. Embrace it!
I'll tell you what, I'll embrace the "hydrant-Phoebe connection" when I can turn the hydrant and coffee comes out. Now, that's a connection I could get behind.
Oh my God, Chandler, look at this bathroom. Can you imagine if we actually had to fit all of my beauty products in there?
Well, given the size of your beauty product collection, I think the only way they’d all fit is if we didn’t have a toilet. Which would be, well, problematic.
Seriously, though, it's so tiny! Where would we even hang the towels? There's like, no space at all!
You clearly haven’t heard of my revolutionary idea: The wearable towel. You know, you just never take it off; it’s both fashion-forward and functional.
Ha-ha. Very funny, Chandler. Imagine trying to do a full skincare routine in here, I mean, I wouldn't even have room for my moisturizers, let alone face masks!
The horror. Looks like you'd have to narrow it down to what, just five essential items? I'm getting the shivers just thinking about it.
What about my hair products, Chandler? Where would I keep my hairdryer, my straightener?
Well, I guess you could always try the natural look—what's it called again? Oh right, air-dried chic. I hear it's all the rage in places with... no electricity.
You know, in my old place, I had enough room for all my bath oils and... Oh, those were the days.
Yes, the golden age of bath oils and the subsequent 'Slip n' Slide' incidents in your bathroom. How will history ever forget?
Okay, so maybe I went a little overboard once or twice. I just like things to be nice, okay?
And by 'nice' you mean being able to open a portal to an alternate bathroom universe where the cabinets are endless and conditioner flows freely from the faucets.
Hey, Chandler, check out this kitchen! That's a lotta jars... think there's any jam in there?
I don't know, Joe. Maybe if we're lucky, there's a jar labeled "Custard. Good. Jam. Good. Meat. Good."
Aw man, you remember that? Yeah, everything's good! But seriously, you think we can ask that chef to whip up something with that stuff?
I'm sure if you ask nicely, he could serve you "Paper! Snow! A ghost!" But Joey, you can't just ask a chef in a picture to cook for you.
Right, the picture thing. But hey, if he could, I bet he'd make a killer turkey. One I wouldn't have to share.
Would that be before or after the meat sweats kicked in?
Before, during, and after, my friend. Speaking of which, I'm starving. We should find a place like that for real.
And it's settled. After all, who am I to stand between Joey Tribbiani and a kitchen full of potential sandwiches. Let's go find you some food that's not trapped in a photo. Could we BE any hungrier?
Oh my gosh, Chandler, look at this place. It's so quaint and colorful. It totally reminds me of that little bistro we went to that one time, remember? The one with the ridiculously small chairs...

Ah yes, how could I forget the chair saga? I felt like Gulliver in a land of Lilliputian seating. And yes, colorful is one word for it. I'm not sure whether I'm in a restaurant or if I accidentally stumbled into a paintball game.

Come on, it's got character. And look at that cute little altar in the corner. I bet that's for good luck or something. It’d be nice if we had something like that at the apartment... might bring some luck in keeping Ross from bringing over more fossils.
As long as it doesn't bring Janice back, I'm all for it. Speaking of which, maybe we could put a little picture of her there and scare away the evil spirits. And customers.

Ha-ha, you kill me, you know that? But seriously, do you think we could pull off something like this for Monica's birthday party? I mean, if we tone down the purple, maybe get a few similar decorations... Could be fun, no?
You want to turn my living room into this? Are you asking because you actually value my opinion, or are we just pretending here?
Well, I do value your opinion, Chandler... when it comes to jokes and sarcasm. But for decor advice, I might stick to flipping through my good ol’ Yummy Mummy catalogs.
And by the way, what exactly is served on this table? Because it looks like a science experiment I did in the 7th grade. A very unsuccessful experiment.
Chandler! Be nice! It’s probably some local delicacy... unlike that trifle I made.
Now hold on, let’s not say things we can’t take back. Your trifle has become the benchmark against which all other culinary disasters are measured.
Ok, Mr. Bing, since you’re such a food critic, how about you pick where we eat tonight?
I thought you'd never ask! I choose... anywhere that doesn't make me feel like I'm in a dollhouse gone rogue.
Look at this, Chandler. The boats have this worn, rustic charm, don't they? I bet they’ve seen a lot of early mornings and fresh catches.
Yeah, and they’ve probably seen a lot of fish guts too. Remind me why we’re looking at boats instead of cute puppies?
Because there's something poetic about the sea and those who work with it. Don't you think there's a story behind each of these boats and the people who sail them?
Absolutely, each boat tells the epic tale of the one that got away... and I'm not talking about fish, I'm talking about those hours of sleep they lost.
Oh c'mon, don't you get curious about the lives of fishermen, braving the waves, bringing in the catch of the day that could potentially be the centerpiece of a wonderful meal?

If by "braving the waves," you mean avoiding a sea of Janice-like laughter and by "centerpiece of a wonderful meal," you mean the number "seven" at the all-you-can-eat sushi joint, then yes, absolutely.
You’re impossible. But look at the guy sitting there, he seems so deep in thought. I wonder what he's contemplating?
Well, if he's anything like me, he's wondering why he didn't take the cubicle job with the view of the break room vending machine.
Not everyone dreams of a life behind a desk, Bing. Some people love the adventure, the unpredictability of the ocean.

And some people love not being sunburned and smelling like bait. To each their own. Now, can we go back to imagining this as a beautiful location for another one of your infamous competitive beach games?
Fine, but only if you agree that the winning team gets to decide where we eat after – and it has to be seafood.
Could there BE any more conditions? You’ve got yourself a deal. But remember, if the seafood place is Monica clean, I’m picking every future eaterie.
Deal, but fair warning, I’ll make sure every place from here on out is "Monica clean".

Look at this, Chandler. It's so serene, just the clock and the dark sky. Maybe it's time we finally planned that trip to Paris we keep talking about. Imagine us there, having a romantic dinner, not worrying about a thing.
