Could that BE any more of a beautiful thought? Just imagine all the things we could do in Paris. I mean, aside from the obvious eating and you criticizing the French for not keeping their streets Monica clean.

Ha-ha. Very funny. I just think it would be amazing, you know? Just us and 'The City of Light.' There's something about that clock, it's almost poetic—like time standing still. Makes you want to seize the moment.

I agree. We can seize and do the stuff and things... But does time really stand still, or does it sneak up on you when you're trying to sneak an extra croissant? Why do I feel like we would spend half our trip just trying to reset our watches to the right time zone?

And the other half, you'd be trying to convince me that calorie counting doesn't exist in Europe, right? But seriously, Chandler, I want to experience everything with you. Days where we can just explore without a schedule, that to me is the real vacation.
I'm fully on board for the no-schedule thing. Walking down the Seine with you, unleashing my sarcasm on unsuspecting French mimes. It's the stuff dreams are made of.
Did you just say that without a hint of sarcasm? I'm impressed. Maybe we should start taking French lessons. You can tell the mimes they're being too loud.

And you can ask them in perfect French why seven is their favorite number. But in all seriousness, Mon, a trip with you would be perfection. Even if I do have to eat snails with a side of your obsessive itinerary planning.
You love my planning and you know it. Okay, let's make this a goal. By the time that clock strikes... Whatever time we fancy, because we're jet setting to Europe, baby!
Jet setting with you? Gum would be perfection, but that would be... what's a level above perfection?
It's a 'Monica and Chandler' kind of perfection, that's what it is.
Oh my God, Chandler, look at this! That's croquet, right? You know, we should have a game night with croquet involved. I bet I could whip you all. It's all about precision and focus.

And here I was, thinking our apartment couldn't possibly fit any more competitive sports. But sure, as long as we don't have to wear the fancy hats and sip tea, I'm in. Although, I should warn you, I've played croquet before. Spoiler alert: Lawn 1, Chandler 0.
Are you kidding me? Lawn sports are where I shine! Remember that time I dominated at lawn darts? And I don't need the fancy hat, but it wouldn’t hurt to dress the part.

Yes, your lawn dart skills are legendary. And as much as I enjoy the image of you in a giant sun hat, accusing the lawn of cheating, I'm not sure I'm emotionally ready for another Geller competitive streak.
C'mon, you love it! And this time, it won't just be me you have to worry about. I'll train Phoebe and Rachel, too. We'll have a croquet army!
Great, so not only do I have to worry about losing, but I have to worry about losing to an army of croquet-wielding women led by my ultra-competitive wife. Could my weekends BE any more harrowing?
Stop being such a baby. It'll be fun! Plus, if you're a good boy, I might just make some jam tarts and finger sandwiches.
In that case, bring on the mallets! And just for the record, I was once known as 'Chandler the Mallet Handler' in college.
Really? Because that sounds like the kind of nickname you give yourself when nobody else will play with you.
Haha, very funny. No, I actually just made that up. But if it scares Joey into thinking I'm some kind of croquet savant and he goes easy on me... then my work here is done.
Just remember, honey, if you lose, there's always the consolation prize of my Monica Clean house and my love. But let's face it, you're not gonna stand a chance against me and my croquet skills!

I'm counting on that consolation prize. And when you get all competitive and start doing that thing where you squint one eye and stick your tongue out, know that I'll be there, cheering you on... from a safe distance, behind the sofa, with a jam tart in hand.
Hey, Chandler, check out this image. That little kid's trying to eat a carrot! Reminds me of when I offered you some of my fries and you were like, all trying to be healthy.

Yeah, I remember, it was a time of deep personal growth and, you know... hunger. But honestly, Joey, if you think that's how I look when I eat a carrot, you must think all that hair gel has seeped into your brain.
Ha! No way, man. I just mean it's funny seeing a kid get started on solid food. I mean, what's that face he's making? It's like he's thinking, "Could this BE any more orange?"
Nice try. But you gotta leave the sarcasm to the professionals. And by the way, do you think babies concern themselves with color coordination? Because if so, I've been doing things all wrong.

Chan-man, babies know more than we think. Like that look, maybe he's onto the fact that carrots are good for the eyes. If that's true, I should have had way more carrots to spot those casting directors better.

Or, perhaps your keen fashion sense could have been improved and you wouldn't have worn all those 'interesting' shirts to auditions. Seriously, though, that mom looks super proud, giving her kid a start on healthy eating habits. We had nothing but pizza and sandwiches. Not that I would trade those, of course.
Yeah, if that kid's anything like me, he's in for a lifetime of loving food. But, no way, man. Joey doesn't share food, not even with cute babies. Those sandwiches and pizzas are mine!
Which explains why you 'mysteriously' never had any snacks whenever I was around. Anyway, look at the baby’s little hat. It's almost as if it's saying, "I'm a serious carrot eater. Respect the hat."
Respect the hat, ha! You crack me up, Chandler. But you know, that hat is pretty cool. I wonder if they make those in my size.
If they do, I'm getting you one for Christmas, and you have to wear it every time you eat one of your meatball subs.
